abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Prevention and
            Management of Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of
            Argentina's Epidemiological System Project is to
            strengthen the capacity of the Borrower's
            epidemiological health surveillance system to: a) prevent,
            monitor and evaluate influenza activity, and b) control
            epidemic waves of A/H1N1 influenza. The project was
            restructured to: process a partial cancelation of US$88
            million of the loan amount; and reallocate loan proceeds. A
            second restructuring was approved on March 9, 2012 to: 1)
            extend the project's closing date by 12 months from
            March 31, 2012, to March 31, 2013, 2) adjust the project
            indicators in table one of the emergency project paper, and
            3) reallocate loan proceeds. The extension will allow the
            project to achieve the targets of the two remaining Project
            Intermediate Outcome Indicators (PDIs): number of situation
            analysis rooms certified, and number of situation rooms that
            achieve a highly satisfactory level of accreditation at the
            end of the project (above 80 percent).
